title: Button Oak Walks

images.title: Looking towards the back of the Button Oak pub by P L Chadwick, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Looking towards the back of the Button Oak pub

images.title: Public footpath from Wyre Forest to the village of Buttonoak by P L Chadwick, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Public footpath from Wyre Forest to the village of Buttonoak

images.title: P L Chadwick / Route of pipeline in Wyre Forest
images.caption: Route of pipeline in Wyre Forest. Under this broad avenue lies the pipeline supplying water from Wales to the Birmingham area. The havoc caused by its construction has now largely healed. This view is looking in the direction of Buttonoak. There is a public right of way along here.

images.title: P L Chadwick / Minor path with bluebells in Wyre Forest
images.caption: Minor path with bluebells in Wyre Forest. Bluebells were still out in the forest in mid-May, and there are some groups of them on both sides of this path.

images.title: National Cycle Route 45 towards Buttonoak by Mat Fascione, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: National Cycle Route 45 towards Buttonoak

description: This circular walk visits the village of Button Oak in the Wyre Forest near Bewdley. The area includes the Button Oak Meadow nature reserve where you'll find some pleasant woodland trails with lots of flora and fauna to see. Keep your eyes peeled for wildlife like deer, squirrels and various woodland birds. You can start your walk from the car park opposite the meadow. Then follow the trails heading west into the peaceful woodland.

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: The Button Oak Inn is located in the village and a nice place for refreshments after your exercise. You can enjoy a good meal in the spacious garden area if the weather is good.

details.subtitle: Dog Walking
details.content: The woodland trails are great for dog walking. You are requested to keep them on leads in the Button Oak Meadow nature reserve area. The inn mentioned above is also dog friendly.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: Head east and there's some nice waterside trails along the River Severn on the Severn Way. Trimpley Reservoir is also located in this area. For more walking ideas in the area see the Worcestershire Walks page.
